intro: Pandanus calamianensis, commonly known as the Calamian pandanus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and long, narrow leaves that are often used in traditional weaving. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters at the base of the leaves. Its roots are fibrous and can be used for various practical purposes. This species is adapted to coastal and wetland environments, making it an important part of the local ecosystem.
